djf.controller

Class AppFileController

  • java.lang.Object
    • djf.controller.AppFileController

  • public class AppFileController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides the event programmed responses for the file controls that are provided by this framework.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AppFileController(AppTemplate initApp)
      This constructor just keeps the app for later.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void copy(java.lang.String oldPath, java.lang.String newPath) 
      void handleExitRequest()
      This method will exit the application, making sure the user doesn't lose any data first.
      void handleExportRequest() 
      void handleLoadRequest()
      This method lets the user open a Course saved to a file.
      void handleNewRequest()
      This method starts the process of editing new Work.
      void handleSaveAsRequest() 
      void handleSaveRequest()
      This method will save the current course to a file.
      boolean isSaved()
      Accessor method for checking to see if the current work has been saved since it was last edited.
      void markAsEdited(AppGUI gui)
      This method marks the appropriate variable such that we know that the current Work has been edited since it's been saved.
      void markFileAsNotSaved()
      This mutator method marks the file as not saved, which means that when the user wants to do a file-type operation, we should prompt the user to save current work first.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • AppFileController

        public AppFileController(AppTemplate initApp)
        This constructor just keeps the app for later.
        Parameters:
        initApp - The application within which this controller will provide file toolbar responses.

    • Method Detail

      • markAsEdited

        public void markAsEdited(AppGUI gui)
        This method marks the appropriate variable such that we know that the current Work has been edited since it's been saved. The UI is then updated to reflect this.
        Parameters:
        gui - The user interface editing the Work.

      • handleNewRequest

        public void handleNewRequest()
        This method starts the process of editing new Work. If work is already being edited, it will prompt the user to save it first.

      • handleLoadRequest

        public void handleLoadRequest()
        This method lets the user open a Course saved to a file. It will also make sure data for the current Course is not lost.

      • handleSaveRequest

        public void handleSaveRequest()
        This method will save the current course to a file. Note that we already know the name of the file, so we won't need to prompt the user.

      • handleSaveAsRequest

        public void handleSaveAsRequest()

      • handleExportRequest

        public void handleExportRequest()

      • copy

        public void copy(java.lang.String oldPath,
                 java.lang.String newPath)

      • handleExitRequest

        public void handleExitRequest()
        This method will exit the application, making sure the user doesn't lose any data first.

      • markFileAsNotSaved

        public void markFileAsNotSaved()
        This mutator method marks the file as not saved, which means that when the user wants to do a file-type operation, we should prompt the user to save current work first. Note that this method should be called any time the course is changed in some way.

      • isSaved

        public boolean isSaved()
        Accessor method for checking to see if the current work has been saved since it was last edited.
        Returns:
        true if the current work is saved to the file, false otherwise.
